text: The Nunatta Sunakkutaangit Museum is a museum of Nunavut history and Inuit culture. It is located in Nunavut's capital of Iqualuit. Two employees of Canada's Department of Indian Affairs started the museum in 1969. A Hudson's Bay Company building was moved on tracks from Apex to Iqualuit to be made into the museum. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official site Category:1969 establishments in Canada Category:Nunavut Category:Museums in Canada
title: Nunatta Sunakkutaangit Museum
